vague_description: Determine the optimal distribution of regular and emergency fire fighters given constraints on hours needed and budget.
detailed_description: A fire department employs regular and emergency fire fighters. A regular fire fighter works \param{HoursRegular} hours per shift and earns \param{EarningsRegular}. An emergency fire fighter works \param{HoursEmergency} hours per shift and earns \param{EarningsEmergency}. Due to wildfires in the region, the fire department needs at least \param{MinHours} hours of fire fighter time. If the fire department has a budget of \param{Budget}, how many of each should the fire department hire to minimize the total number of fire fighters?
target_objective: Minimize the total number of fire fighters hired
target_constraints: Minimum required fire fighter hours is MinHours
The budget for hiring fire fighters is Budget
Number of regular fire fighters is non-negative
Number of emergency fire fighters is non-negative
target_parameters: Hours per shift for a regular fire fighter
Earnings per shift for a regular fire fighter
Hours per shift for an emergency fire fighter
Earnings per shift for an emergency fire fighter
Minimum required fire fighter hours due to wildfires
Available budget for hiring fire fighters
